title: Manager, Marketing
description:
About you

You’re an ambitious marketer with a track record of producing results. You’ve achieved those results as part of a team, but you want to take the lead to show what you can really do. You want to play a key role in brainstorming, project scoping, and executing various initiatives in B2B marketing. You want to grow your area of responsibility and your career. You turn vision into action and love measuring your progress. You’re motivated to work in a small, fast growth business where you have lots of influence.

About us

Concord is the proud owner of the Pro.file Performance System, a world class personality tool for hiring, managing, and growing teams. For over 26 years we’ve been teaching managers and leaders around the world about the impact of “Personality on Performance”. We are firm believers that when there’s a great fit between an employee and their job, great things happen. We’re in the process of rebranding, and we need your help to increase our visibility and drive more leads for the sales team.

About the role

The Manager, Marketing will work closely with leadership to develop and deploy marketing initiatives in support of new client growth goals. You will oversee the company’s marketing efforts to drive sales and build brand awareness with current and prospective clients. Responsibilities include developing an overall marketing plan, measuring the return on investment, and improving those results.

  • Develop and execute initiatives specifically within the B2B space that increases brand awareness and drives leads for the business
  • Lead and execute the organization's digital marketing objectives and tactics
  • Manage the refinement of our website to optimize customer attraction
  • Develop comprehensive integrated marketing plans to increase awareness, accelerate the sales cycle, and increase sales across multiple channels, in support of sales priorities and revenue goals
  • Manage the content strategy for both newsletters and blogs
  • Work closely with the sales team on ideas and tactics to grow exposure
  • Establish metrics and scorecards to track and optimize program effectiveness, lead performance and pipeline generation
  • Proven ability to take initiative, influence others and achieve results
  • Strong analytical, problem solving and planning skills

Qualifications

  • Five years of marketing experience
  • Demonstrated ability to attract and convert prospects into clients
  • Experience with online marketing, database marketing, social media marketing and CRM
  • Post-secondary (University or College) education preferred
  • Excellent written and verbal presentation skills - especially for C-suite audiences

Part of our hiring process is confirming that there’s a great match between our applicants and the job. As such, you will be asked to complete a short personality survey. You will receive an email invitation for this survey from Concord.

While we thank you in advance for your interest and application, please be advised that we will only be responding to candidates selected for further consideration.

title: Content Marketing Manager - Marketing
description:
Let’s impact lives for the better!

Alberta Blue Cross® is an Alberta based organization dedicated to delivering exceptional customer experience and community leadership. We’re committed to providing the best health coverage to over 1.8 million members and take an active role in promoting wellness. We believe in what we do—and place trust in our employees to deliver our vision.

Working at Alberta Blue Cross® means having a career where you’ll be recognized for your contributions. We value diversity, encourage our employees to maintain a healthy work-life balance and provide opportunities for career growth.

OVERVIEW:

Our Marketing and Customer Experience team is growing!

We are looking for an experienced Content Marketing Manager to join our team. If you understand the power of quality content and know how to use it to engage customers and drive business success, we want you on our team!

The Content Marketing Manager is a new role responsible for developing, implementing and managing Alberta Blue Cross’s overall content marketing strategy. You will be accountable for developing strategies that deliver targeted, engaging, and valuable multimedia branded content to different audiences. You will work with your colleagues to plan the most effective distribution channels that drive customer engagement and help build brand equity.

Reporting to the Director of Marketing, the Content Marketing Manager is responsible for guiding the strategic direction of our marketing content and content distribution plan. This role will work closely with content contributors and business units across the organization.

Working in a flexible work style arrangement, you will have the flexibility to decide where and when you work. While you may be working remotely most of the time, there will be ample opportunity for face-to-face interactions, external and in-office meetings, team events, and other meaningful connections.

WHAT WILL YOU DO:

  • Lead the creation of Alberta Blue Cross’s content marketing framework introducing content marketing best practices
  • Lead the creation and execution of Alberta Blue Cross’s content marketing strategy ensuring it aligns to our corporate strategy, image, values, and stellar reputation
  • Gather data and insight around customer segments and target personas—identifying customer needs, problems, desires and media consumption and preferences. You will recommend content themes, formats and channels that add value to our customers and drive meaningful engagement with our brand.
  • Collaborate with internal business units to ensure the content plan and its execution drive business success across customer segments and along the customer journey
  • Ensure Alberta Blue Cross’s thought leaders are partnered well for knowledgeable, authentic, compelling, and timely customer-centric content
  • Create and contribute to the development of content briefs and work closely with the digital, communications and marketing teams to ensure content is compelling, informative, engaging and meets business objectives
  • Leverage market intelligence and voice of the customer to ensure targeted messages are delivered to targeted audiences and at the right time
  • Collaborate with the Corporate Communications team, external freelancers, and media partners to ensure the seamless integration, distribution, and production of engaging content
  • Routinely measure and assess content performance against KPIs to ensure meaningful engagements are optimized
  • Contribute on a cross-functional team to help build out Alberta Blue Cross’s marketing technology stack, specifically with technology related to marketing content management
  • Establish a deep knowledge of the industry, use networks and partnerships to proactively identify opportunities for content collaborations and innovation
  • Collaborate with marketing colleagues to ensure the content strategy is integrated into other marketing campaigns and leverages online and offline channels
  • Facilitate ongoing content workflow planning by creating, and effectively communicating the content schedule outlining the creation, publication, and promotion of marketing content
  • Champion the development and integration of new content formats and oversee the development and launch into new marketing content channels for Alberta Blue Cross
  • Evaluate and recommend partners to assist in creating and curating content and secure and oversee content freelancers, when required

WHAT YOU WILL HAVE:

  • Deep business acumen and high competency in content marketing, journalism, media relations, or communications, particularly on digital assets;
  • Experience with written, video, and interactive content production, and their respective best practices, workflows, and capabilities;
  • Experience developing and executing content marketing and customer engagement strategies and the ability to adapt content to various channels while supporting brand goals;
  • Well established understanding of earned, shared and owned media and are abreast of changing customer engagement tools and trends;
  • Digital and social media experience with proven working knowledge of SEM, SEO; understanding of email, mobile, social and web design principles; knowledge of best practices within the content marketing industry; Google Analytics certification would be an asset;
  • Knowledge of audience and digital traffic metrics, marketing analytics tools, and social amplification techniques;
  • Proficiency in project management and experience managing editorial calendars and multiple projects;
  • Proven success working with thought leaders and subject matter experts;
  • A high level of professionalism with exceptional verbal and written communication skills;
  • Familiarity and knowledge of brand strategy, positioning and customer segment targeting;
  • Exceptional collaboration skills with the proven ability to build positive, productive and trusted relationships with diverse groups of people always displaying an appreciation for processes, change management and organizational culture.
  • A results-driven mindset, be a creative problem solver and big picture thinker with attention to detail, all while working in a busy, inclusive environment.
  • Relevant education, preferably with a degree in journalism, business, marketing, or related field.

Alberta Blue Cross® is an inclusive employer committed to a workplace that reflects the diversity of the communities we serve. We empower and are advocates for our employees by welcoming, respecting and valuing their unique perspectives, backgrounds, and experiences.

We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the opportunity to work in an innovative, high-energy team-focused environment. This position will remain open until a suitable candidate is selected. If you have the qualifications we are looking for, apply online at careers.ab.bluecross.ca.

As a condition of employment, successful job applicants will be asked to confirm their COVID-19 vaccination status and may be required to provide proof of a valid negative COVID-19 test or a valid exemption pursuant to applicable human rights law if not fully vaccinated.

Manages all internal and external communication, digital presence, including but not limited to property website, third party channels and social media while maintaining brand integrity. the sales, marketing, digital or related professional area; hospitality marketing or digital advertising experience preferred

Marketing and Digital

  • Supports group lead generation efforts.
  • Runs, reviews, analyzes and clearly articulates to stakeholders’ key reports and adjust strategy accordingly.
  • Manages internal and external partners to verify deliverables are executed to support hotel strategy.
  • Develops annual digital marketing plan to maximize hotel revenue production and identify digital marketing opportunities on third party and local partner sites.
  • Monitors and provides recommendations for SEO and update as needed in collaboration with MDS or agency.

Content Management

  • Sets overarching messaging strategy for hotel/group of hotels aligned with positioning.
  • Manages Marriott.com content (via EPIC, Efast, MDS Client Community, etc.), OTA content (via respective extranet sites) and Third-Party / Group Site content (via respective content management systems).
  • Manages photography distribution including search photos, pre-arrival photos, and photo gallery management.

Partnerships and Public Relations

  • Assists in reviewing social media content calendars and collect local area and property events.

distribution), etc.

  • Demonstrates the ability to create and maintain strong relationships and negotiation skills with key internal and external partners/stakeholders (e.g. GMs, Sales and Revenue Leaders, Regional Team, media representatives).

CPP Distribution is a culture-based company that has the drive to become the number one sought out distributor of niche consumable brands servicing the energy sectors worldwide.

title: Marketing Manager
description:
Hiring: Marketing Manager

About the Company:

We are an award-winning small business, with 13 years in manufacturing and retailing of luxury confectionary products. We are a Sherwood Park based organization with a retail store, wholesale partners & an online store, shipping across Canada.

We are currently seeking a Marketing Manager to manage all marketing activities including strategy development, campaign management, story-telling, managing our Shopify store, traffic acquisition, online revenue, conversion, a/b testing and reporting.

Our Culture

The ideal fit will be a candidate with an entrepreneurial spirit that is ready to dive into a dynamic work environment and be highly resourceful. We are a team of chocolatiers, business and creative professionals that share a core purpose to spread joy in an environment of teamwork, artistry, continuous improvement and excellence.

The role responsibilities will include:

  • Managing the brand through innovative marketing to constantly improve the customer experience both online, instore and in our corporate sales program.
  • Continuously develop, implement and manage an ecommerce strategy aimed at optimizing our online presence and maximizing revenue.
  • Collaborate with external agencies to improve website performance, update themes, and implement other enhancements as needed for an optimal customer experience.
  • Analyze data to develop and implement data driven strategies needed to achieve KPI’s.
  • Research market for trends and technologies to continually improve the ecommerce performance and customer online shopping experience.
  • Directly manage digital marketing channels across PPC, SEO, SEM, affiliates, email marketing and social media.
  • Develop and execute on a social media content calendar, oversee website uploads, and manage landing page development.
  • Maintain website content pages and ecommerce pages and prepare them for new (seasonal) product launches.
  • Collaborate with Graphic Designer on product photoshoots to create database of product visuals be used on the website and social media

The ideal candidate will have:

  • at least 3 years of experience in a similar role with a proven track record and ideally with an agency background or in the retail or CPG industry.
  • a passion for solving problems while wearing multiple hats and owning the in-person and online customer journey from start to finish.
  • experience developing and implementing digital and traditional marketing strategies.
  • an understanding and experience (ideally) in Shopify, Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, Sprout Social, Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager, and ShipStation.
  • knowledge and experience working with digital marketing channels such as PPC ,SEO, SEM, Email, and affiliate marketing channels.
  • post-secondary education in Business, (Digital) Marketing or related field is an asset.

Position Details

  • The role will work closely with the Founder and will have one direct report (Graphic Designer).
  • This is a full-time position based at our Sherwood Park chocolate studio (in-person).
  • A Health & Wellness Plan is offered once the probation period has been reached.

To apply, please include a cover letter with examples of your past marketing wins and how you could see using your experience to build and grow JACEK to help us spread more joy!

The H.B.P.A. serves to protect and maintain the interests of the owners, trainers, and employees who have an investment in the multi-million dollar Thoroughbred Racing industry.

The HBPA of Alberta is searching for a dynamic social media manager to assist with promoting live racing and to showcase our equine athletes for the world to see. This individual will be energetic, self motivated and able to think for themselves. The ideal candidate will have extensive experience with Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Tik Tok, Snapchat and Canva. The perfect candidate will also have a working knowledge of the Thoroughbred Horse racing industry and be able to present our product in a positive light.

THE OPPORTUNITY
Are you a results-driven communications professional ready to take your career to the next level? This is an exciting, high-impact opportunity to play a key role in leading strategic communications activities for the Safety Codes Council.
Reporting to the Manager of Stakeholder Relations, the Communications Lead is responsible for internal and external communications activities for the Safety Codes Council and aligns communications activities with the strategic objectives and priorities of the Council. You are a passionate and persuasive communicator who thrives on interacting with stakeholders at all organizational levels, from front-line staff to the executive team. You are collaborative and creative with a keen eye for detail, bringing with you an innovative and diverse portfolio of experience.
Your role is responsible for developing strategic communications plans for key transformational projects and reporting their progress, and communicating to a variety of audiences through the web and on social media platforms. Working with a talented team of professionals, you will be a fundamental component of the voice of the Council.

WHO WE ARE AND WHAT WE DO
The Safety Codes Council (Council) is an independent regulatory body established in 1993 under the Safety Codes Act. The Council provides oversight of Alberta’s safety codes system through a number of key mandated functions including:

  • Accrediting and monitoring the compliance of municipalities, agencies, corporations, and regional service commissions in administering the Safety Codes Act within specified jurisdictions.
  • For the 300,000 Albertans who live in unaccredited areas of the province, the Alberta Safety Codes Authority (ASCA) , conducts permitting, inspections and oversees spill and incident reporting requirements for storage tank systems across the province.
  • Training and certifying safety codes officers to inspect the construction, installation and maintenance of Alberta’s structures and systems and administering Alberta’s Master Electrician program.
  • Reviewing, formulating, safety codes and standards, and evaluating emerging issues in the safety codes system to provide recommendations to Alberta Municipal Affairs.
  • Investigating complaints and conducting investigations on the conduct, performance, or competency of an organization or individual having authority, powers, or duties under the Safety Codes Act.
  • Conducting hearings and appeals of orders and written notices issued under the authority of the Safety Codes Act.

Key Responsibilities and Deliverables

  • Planning, coordinating, writing and editing news releases, information bulletins, media notices, letters, briefings, brochures, reports, speeches, presentations, newsletters and other publications.
  • Evaluates the Council’s communications needs and ensures the communications strategy is aligned with the Council’s strategic objectives.
  • In coordination with lead subject matter experts, supports the execution of the strategic communications initiatives for the Council.
  • Provides editorial support including writing, copyediting and reviewing Council’s externally published corporate plans including the Council’s Annual Report, Business Plan, and related documents.
  • Copyedits Council published documents, including codes, standards, and reports.
  • Researches and develops content with the goal of educating the public and industry on key topics in the safety codes system; presenting technical information in an accessible manner.
  • Develops and distributes communications collateral for the Council’s distinct stakeholder groups, ensuring that the content and distribution method is appropriate for the intended audience.

title: Fund Development & Communications Manager - 1 FTE
description:
Kids Kottage Foundation

Fund Development & Communications Manager – 1.0 FTE

Are you passionate about serving your community? Are you an experienced fund development professional eager to make a difference in the lives of infants and children?

Kids Kottage Foundation (KKF) is currently searching for the perfect candidate to serve as our Fund Development and Communications Manager who is responsible for creating the organization’s philanthropic strategy and operationalizing it.

Kids Kottage Foundation is significantly funded through corporate and personal donations, funds from events, and grants. The perfect candidate will promote the vision of the organization ensuring maximum brand awareness and donor impact to the community. In cooperation with the Executive Director, you will lead the organization in all aspects of fund development and communications, truly driving funds that are used to care for vulnerable infants and children.

In this role, you will lead a dynamic team to accomplish the organization’s fundraising and communications goals by providing oversight to KKF’s database administrator, and communications and marketing team.

This is an external facing role that emphasizes donor relations, gift solicitation, grant writing to non-government agencies, and the management of all fundraising opportunities. This position is a key driver in designing and executing short and long-term fundraising goals for KKF and is responsible for ensuring that those goals are met.

Key Responsibilities:

· Develops a philanthropic strategy for the organization;

· Directs the communications and marketing team to develop all materials to achieve strategic goals;

· Actively participates in the daily activities of KKF, particularly those relating to philanthropy, connecting with the Program Manager, Accounting Department, and staff as appropriate on the established philanthropic goals.

· Responsible for fostering a philanthropic culture among KKF staff and board;

· Creates and manages a portfolio of KKF donors - large and small - acquiring, renewing, and upgrading donors using a variety of cultivation tools and activities;

· Develops and executes creative strategies to expand the donor base, ensuring a robust prospect pipeline;

· Brings innovation and revision to the Sponsorship program making it relevant and exciting for corporate donors;

· Plays a lead role in the planning and execution of a variety of fundraisers, community and stewardship events (e.g. annual fundraising event, donor appreciation event and annual general meeting);

· Serves as the lead on all aspects of grant and foundation research, relationship building and written application development;

· Oversees volunteer and community engagement activities including the Volunteer Connector program.

Qualifications:

· At least 5-7 years’ experience with nonprofit fund development, including major gift, annual and business sponsorships

· Computer literacy and a knowledge of donor database systems

· Experience and knowledge using Raiser’s Edge NXT software, MS Windows, databases and Excel

· Ability to use social media for fundraising and donor cultivation

· Outstanding interpersonal, communication, writing and public speaking skills

· Able to build and maintain lasting relationships with key donors, partners, stakeholders, staff, and volunteers

· Exemplary planning skills: ability to identify strategies to move the organization forward, set goals, create, and implement action plans, and evaluate the process and results

· Current Driver’s License with valid proof of insurance.

Required Education:

· College or University diploma/degree. Preferences will be given to candidates with education in Business, Communications, Marketing and Non-profit Management;

· Current Certified Fundraising Professional Executive certification is required.

Work Environment

· Full-Time position, 37.5 hours of work/week. Flexible hours; including evening and occasional weekends are required.

· This position is based out of Kids Kottage Foundation Administration Office, and also requires working in the community.

Salary:

· Based on education, skills, abilities, and experience. Upon completion of a probationary period, we additionally offer a comprehensive, competitive, extended health benefits package.

How to Apply:

· Please email your resume and cover letter to dataentry.hr@ kidskottage.org

· Please include Fund Development Manager in the subject line of the email and state your salary expectations in the cover letter.

· Website: www.kidskottage.org

**We appreciate the interest of all applicants. However, we will only contact those selected for an interview. **

Closing Date: Open until a suitable candidate is found.

Screening Criteria:

As an employer who values diversity in its workforce, we encourage all candidates who self-identify as members of the following designated groups: women, visible minorities, Indigenous peoples and persons with disabilities to apply.

The COVID-19 Vaccination Verification Policy for Kids Kottage Foundation requires all Kids Kottage Foundation personnel to be fully vaccinated. This is a condition of employment, should you reach the point in the selection process where it is necessary to verify terms and conditions of employment then the hiring manager or a human resources representative will contact you in order to complete a vaccination verification.

Any candidate offered a position may be required to pass pre-employment screenings as mandated by Kids Kottage Foundation. These screenings may include a criminal record check, clear vulnerable sector check.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Benefits:

  • Company events
  • Dental care
  • Employee assistance program
  • Extended health care
  • On-site parking
  • Paid time off

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Day shift
  • Monday to Friday
  • Weekend availability

COVID-19 considerations:
Masks are required to be worn in the office. All staff participate in weekly COVID-19 rapid testing and need to show proof of COVID-19 vaccinations.

Ability to commute/relocate:

  • Edmonton, AB T5E 1J2: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (required)

Licence/Certification:

  • Driver's Licence (required)
